name: Imhotep
title: Imhotep - Egyptian Mythology
subtitle: Deified Sage, Architect, and Physician
shortDescription: Imhotep was a historical figure (c. 2650 BCE) who served Pharaoh Djoser as architect, physician, and sage. He designed the Step Pyramid at Saqqara , revolutionizing Egyptian architecture. Later deified as god of medicine, wisdom, and writing. Greeks identified him with Asclepius. Worshipped by scribes and healers seeking his wisdom and healing power .
longDescription: Full detailed mythology and worship information coming soon. For now, see related deities and use the corpus search to explore ancient texts mentioning Imhotep.
